intro: Gnaphalium subfalcatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, surrounded by narrow, linear leaves. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is known for its long-lasting flowers, which are used in floral arrangements and traditional medicine.
